title: Add invert to DigitalIn/DigitalInOut/DigitalOut
body:
This Pull Request allows inverting of a Pin.
This is usefull to keep the logic a Programm small and clean.

e.g 
We have a Stepperdriver and a Configfile (on localfilestorage) which defines the used pins (PinName, PinMode, Invert).
Normally en-pin high means that the driver is enabled but with some drivers this is inverted. Same with direction pin, etc.
So we want to set Invert too true to do this else we need to carry this flag through the whole source code.

Another example would be a switch/button. 
If the user use a button which unpressed is closed(true) we can invert the signal.
So the Programm reads true if the button is pressed and the app logic can stay the same.

title: STM32F4 and IAR init
body:
Is there any strategy to reconcile the IAR init process (data zero and copy init) with the current code for SystemInit?  The functions called through SystemInit reference variables that are later initialized in __iar_program_start (through __iar_data_init3), overwriting whatever initialization was performed.

Examples:

SystemCoreClock in system_stm32f4xx.c
TimMasterHandle in hal_tick.c

It seems a bit backwards to set variables, then they get "initialized" later, and then you have to either set them again or have the "initialized" value be what you wanted it to be in the first place.

[NucleoF030R8 - Emblocks offline] HardFault when using wait() with Serial
body:
Hi,

I'm unable to run the simple nucleo_printf example program. In the online IDE it runs fine, but when using the sources in a offline compiler (emblocks 2.3) the program stops and hangs at the wait(1) statement. If i remove the serial comands the program run fine, but i'm unable to debugger (it runs fine until the wait() and never exit) In both cases if i check the stack it is stoped in the HardFault_Handler. This is the stack:

| NR | Address | Function | File | Line |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 0 | 0800396C | HardFault_Handler | startup_stm32f0xx.S | 200 |
| 1 | FFFFFF9 | < signal handler called > |  |  |
| 2 | 080015DE | NVIC_SetVector | cmsis_nvic.c | 47 |
| 3 | 0800366A | us_ticker_init | us_ticker.c | 110 |
| 4 | 080036C6 | us_ticker_read | us_ticker.c | 123 |
| 5 | 0800158C | wait_us | wait_api.c | 28 |
| 6 | 08001558 | wait | wait_api.c | 20 |
| 7 | 08003898 | main | main.cpp | 18 |

The project was done with the mbed source from the trunk in git

the project is here: https://www.sendspace.com/file/auywkt
and the issue on the mbed site here: http://developer.mbed.org/users/mbed_official/code/mbed-src/issues/10

title: GCC ARM optimization flag should be -Os, not -O2 for GCC versions later than 4.5.3
body:
The bug referenced in workspace_tools/toolchains/gcc.py

http://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=46762

has been fixed a long time ago (v 4.5.3) in ARM GCC.
Because of this, we should consider changing the optimization from -O2 to -Os

Also, latest versions of ARM GCC (4.8) have added the   -Og option, which is described as "Optimize for debugging experience rather than speed or size"; this results in considerably smaller code than the current -O0 optimization when DEBUG is set.

Perhaps some way could be added to allow those of us who are debugging and using later ARM gcc versions to use -Og instead of -O0?

title: Ensure that IG (Global) bit is reset in MAC address for K64F and others
body:
I can't get a DHCP address because the MAC address chosen by the mbed library has the IG bit set. My DHCP server doesn't respond with an IP address.

Changing the resultant MAC address from the 0x03 to 0x02 allows me to get an IP address.

See IEE 802.3-2002, Section 3.2.3(b)

Here's a Wireshark analysis of the DHCP discover packet with the unmodified code:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/99482/4940832/36cba0ba-65de-11e4-8b19-23ea61be4ca0.png)

title: [HAL][NRF51822] enable I/O mapping and peripheral dynamic assignment for I2C and SPI
body:
- to enable any digital I/O of nRF51822 to be used as I2C's SDA/SCL or SPI's MISO/MOSI/SCK.
- to avoid conflict between I2C and SPI by dynamically assigning peripheral
  
  The nRF51822's I2C_0 and SPI_0 (I2C_1, SPI_1 and SPIS1) share the same address. They can't be used at the same time. So we use I2C_0 and SPI_1 as default. See nRF51822 address information at nRF51822_PS v2.0.pdf - Table 15 Peripheral instance reference.

See discussion at #573

title: Code revision inserted into binary / filename
body:
(copy paste from [feature suggestion forum](http://developer.mbed.org/forum/bugs-suggestions/topic/3161/))

When using mbed for anything more than a hobby project this is critical....

Perhaps something like

```
- REV_MAJOR = "45\0\0"
- REV_HASH="26658a56112a"
- REV_DATE="2014-01-01 12:00:00"
```

Or when modified:

```
- REV_MAJOR = "45+\0"
- REV_HASH="UNCOMMITED\0\0"
- REV_DATE="2014-01-01 12:00:00"
```

This would obviously will allow users to do stuff like

```
printf("I am version %s, woopie\r\n", REV_MAJOR);
```

Note the zero padding to prevent stuff from shifting around in the binary when the value changes.
It would also be **really** nice if this would (optionally) generate a binary with the following name:

[ProjectName]_REV45.bin

title: OTA  target support for RBL nRF51822 and BLE Nano.
Versioning vs. Continuous Changes
body:
Unfortunately, mbed doesn't feature versioning.

With continuous changes, mbed is difficult to work with, as there's no version number. So no one knows which version one's using. Two users may have incompatible mbed libraries without having an easy way to figure it out. The `MBED_LIBRARY_VERSION` doesn't provide enough information.

I suggest releasing packaged versions, for example on a quarterly basis. Each quarter, the [ZIP master](https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/archive/master.zip) is copied and named with the date i.e. 2014-Q2, saved and made available for download.

Thanks!

'us_ticker_irq_handler()' will fail to recognize when triggering events
body:
Due to the implementation of timestamps as 'uint64_t' and the resolution of function 'us_ticker_read()' which is returning an 'uint32_t' function 'us_ticker_irq_handler()' will fail (in line #40 of file 'mbed/libraries/mbed/common/us_ticker_api.c') to recognize events with a timestamp greater than 0xFFFFFFFF (i.e. beyond the 32-bit representation).

... if ((int64_t)(head->timestamp - us_ticker_read()) <= 0) { ... }

title: Update of STM32L0 Cube driver + NUCLEO_L053R8 hal
[HAL][NRF51822] enable I/O mapping feature of I2C and SPI
body:
1. to enable any digital I/O of nRF51822 to be used as I2C's SDA/SCL or SPI's MISO/MOSI/SCK. 
2. to avoid conflict between I2C and SPI.
   
     The nRF51822's I2C_0 and SPI_0 (I2C_1, SPI_1 and SPIS1) share the same address. They can't be used at the same time. So we use I2C_0  and SPI_1  as default. See nRF51822 address information at nRF51822_PS v2.0.pdf - Table 15 Peripheral instance reference.

If we want to use I2C_1 or SPI_0, we use the following code:

```
I2C i2c1(NRF_I2C_1(p1), p2);                  // SPI spi0(NRF_SPI_0(p3), p4, p5);
```

The Micro `NRF_I2C_1(pin)` will do `((PinName)((uint32_t)pin | 0x10000))` to set a flag.

title: RTX SVC issue with IAR
body:
The assembly generated for some SVC functions is incorrect under IAR ARM 7.20.  The define [RET_osEvent](https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/blob/master/libraries/rtos/rtx/rt_CMSIS.c#L268) leaves it open to the compiler to pick which registers to use.  From what I've seen, it picks registers that don't match what the rest of the code is expecting.

This is the code it generates:

``` Assembly
SVC_2_3(svcSignalWait,  os_InRegs osEvent, int32_t,    uint32_t, RET_osEvent)
__svcSignalWait:
    0x8002d60: 0xb47e         PUSH      {R1-R6}
    0x8002d62: 0x0004         MOVS      R4, R0
    0x8002d64: 0x000b         MOVS      R3, R1
    0x8002d66: 0x0011         MOVS      R1, R2
SVC_2_3(svcSignalWait,  os_InRegs osEvent, int32_t,    uint32_t, RET_osEvent)
    0x8002d68: 0xf8df 0x0354  LDR.W     R0, ??DataTable23       ; svcSignalWait_
    0x8002d6c: 0x4684         MOV       R12, R0
SVC_2_3(svcSignalWait,  os_InRegs osEvent, int32_t,    uint32_t, RET_osEvent)
    0x8002d6e: 0x0018         MOVS      R0, R3
    0x8002d70: 0xdf00         SVC       #0x0
SVC_2_3(svcSignalWait,  os_InRegs osEvent, int32_t,    uint32_t, RET_osEvent)
    0x8002d72: 0x9502         STR       R5, [SP, #0x8]
    0x8002d74: 0x9201         STR       R2, [SP, #0x4]
    0x8002d76: 0x9000         STR       R0, [SP]
SVC_2_3(svcSignalWait,  os_InRegs osEvent, int32_t,    uint32_t, RET_osEvent)
    0x8002d78: 0xa800         ADD       R0, SP, #0x0
    0x8002d7a: 0xc864         LDM       R0!, {R2, R5, R6}
    0x8002d7c: 0xc464         STM       R4!, {R2, R5, R6}
    0x8002d7e: 0x380c         SUBS      R0, R0, #12             ; 0xc
    0x8002d80: 0x3c0c         SUBS      R4, R4, #12             ; 0xc
    0x8002d82: 0xbc7e         POP       {R1-R6}
    0x8002d84: 0x4770         BX        LR
```

You can see in addresses 0x8002d72-0x8002d76, the code is using registers R5, R2 and R0 as opposed to R2, R1, and R0 used by the GCC compiled code.  Manually changing the STR instructions to the correct registers fixes hard faults I was seeing trying to use RTOS timers.

title: [RTOS] Does not function on core M4 (non FPU), (K20D50M)
body:
See: https://developer.mbed.org/questions/5045/mbed-RTOS-support-on-K20D50M/

The issue is here on line 157 (and later again): https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/blob/master/libraries/rtos/rtx/TARGET_M4/TOOLCHAIN_ARM/HAL_CM4.c, where the VSTMDBEQ instruction does not exist for the core M4 without F. Now together with some lines of code around it I think it could easily be fixed with an #ifdef guard. However on the other hand I would expect ARM to support core M4s with RTX. 

So can anyone, maybe at mbed HQ, check if it has to be fixed manually or if there is a newer version that I cannot find?

title: [RTOS][STM32L0] Duplicated "SysTick_Handler" symbol, rtos systick handler not working
body:
1 While compiling apps using online mbed IDE, there is an issue with the "SysTick_Handler" symbol being defined twice: first time in "HAL_CM0.s", second time in "system_stm32l0xx.c"

void SysTick_Handler(void)
{
  HAL_IncTick();
}
Removing this code from "system_stm32l0xx.c" solves the problem formally, but causes another issue:

2 Executing the SysTick_Handler() defined by rtos results in a freeze (endless loop ?)
-- renaming(disabling) SysTick_Handler() makes the rtos working without systick (as expected), threads may be switched using yield() function, thread::wait() function causes a freeze (as expected)
-- renaming the systick_handler from HAL_CM0.s  and executing it from inside the handler defined in system_stm32l0xx.c causes freeze as well.

This issue was noticed using mbed online IDE and nucleo L053R8 board.

BR,

title: Host test plugin improvements
body:
## Rationale

Test API and host tests are using the same functionality to serve mbed platforms with flashing (in most cases copy binary to virtual disk) and platform reset.
Idea behind this pull request is to;
- Consolidate all host test non-generic behavior in separate plugins.
- Divide plugins' families into few groups depending on functionality. For now there are two group (types) of plugins: 
  - 'CopyMethod' and 'ResetMethod'.  First type of plugin implements various mbed platform flashing procedures, second is responsible for reseting mbed platform in order to perform e.g. test.
  - For now test suite is using 'CopyMethod' plugins to copy generated target platform binary but with next pull request this functionality will be also moved to host tests where it belongs - host test will not only reset device and take ownership over device's serial port but will also copy (flash) mbed platform with binary.
- Plugins are statically loaded during module **init**, but I will add functionality which is loading dynamically plugins from plugin directory if they are not registered.
- Some plugins e.g. with support for MPS2 copy / reset are not yet stable but MPS2 related functionality was moved from test suite to plugin to consolidate one responsibility per plugin and remove unnecesary work flow from test suite.
- Test suite should be as "thin" as possible so in future plugins for building will also be introduced and extracted from test suite itself.
- Test suite should be as "thin" as possible so in future plugins for detecting / listing of connected platforms  will also be introduced as separate plugins / CLI tools..
- In future plugins will be attached to command line help of test suite CLI so users can see which plugins attach to which command line switches.
## Validation

I've validated this solution on mbed enabled platform:

```
Test summary:
+--------+---------------+-----------+-----------+---------------------------------------+--------------------+---------------+-------+
| Result | Target        | Toolchain | Test ID   | Test Description                      | Elapsed Time (sec) | Timeout (sec) | Loops |
+--------+---------------+-----------+-----------+---------------------------------------+--------------------+---------------+-------+
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | DTCT_1    | Simple detect test                    |        0.57        |       10      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | EXAMPLE_1 | /dev/null                             |        3.51        |       10      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | MBED_10   | Hello World                           |        0.5         |       10      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | MBED_11   | Ticker Int                            |       11.42        |       20      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | MBED_12   | C++                                   |        1.47        |       10      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | MBED_16   | RTC                                   |        4.84        |       15      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | MBED_2    | stdio                                 |        0.88        |       20      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | MBED_23   | Ticker Int us                         |       11.42        |       15      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | MBED_24   | Timeout Int us                        |       11.56        |       15      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | MBED_25   | Time us                               |       11.44        |       15      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | MBED_26   | Integer constant division             |        1.47        |       10      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | MBED_34   | Ticker Two callbacks                  |       11.44        |       15      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | MBED_A1   | Basic                                 |        1.47        |       10      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | MBED_A21  | Call function before main (mbed_main) |        1.47        |       10      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | MBED_A5   | DigitalIn DigitalOut                  |        1.47        |       10      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | MBED_A6   | DigitalInOut                          |        1.42        |       10      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | MBED_A7   | InterruptIn                           |        9.43        |       10      |  1/1  |
| OK     | NUCLEO_F072RB | uARM      | MBED_A9   | Serial Echo at 115200                 |        6.09        |       10      |  1/1  |

Result: 18 OK

Completed in 135.93 sec

title: [BUILD_RELEASE.py] some missing toolchain entries
body: Added some missing gcc_arm toolchain entries in build_release.py where exporters already existed.

title: [Online Compiler] incorrectly compiles projects with new SoftDevice for nRF51822
[LPC1114]not working GCC_CR make.py p0 test.
body:
Dear all,
I do the test by https://github.com/mbedmicro/mbed/tree/master/libraries/mbed/targets/cmsis/TARGET_NXP/TARGET_LPC11XX_11CXX/TOOLCHAIN_GCC_CR/TARGET_LPC11XX //
But, not working that.

Please refer to my CLI result.
https://gist.github.com/Kazu-zamasu/5ed61233edb2964594f9 //

If you have anu advice, please let me know. Same issue have by GCC_CR 32kbyte Flash.

title: Freescale FRDM-KL43Z
body: I have added support for Freescale FRDM-KL43Z board. Was tested with gcc-arm toolchain (https://launchpad.net/gcc-arm-embedded) only.

title: Host test refactoring  - part2
body:
## Description

This pull request is following previous one. 
Changed host test to support run() and test() method tandem. 
When users will trite their own host tests in future they can just overload test() method and return proper result status which will be handled by Test::run() method.
Current host test improvement are done so host test code is shorter, cleaner and faster. Also control flow goes to one place from each host test.
- Host test refactoring: cleaned a bit functionality of host tests. Forced test() function in DefaultTest to be method returning test result.
- Cleaned pyFlakes issues with unused imports
- Minor style improvement
- This refactoring is also preparing host tests for plug-in architecture improvements.
- Still NET_ related tests can be refactored.
  ## Verification Results
  Before pull request I've ran tests with new host test implementation in CI server. Results below:

title: [export EB] GCC toolchain filter to supported target list.
body: I was expecting that the front-end uses the TOOLCHAIN variable as a first filter which exports are available for export. This isn't true so I have added a filter to the EmBlocks target list to return only the GCC supported targets.

title: [EXPORT] Front-end doesn't filter on toolchain variable
body:
I would expect that the front-end uses the toolchain together with the target list to determine if it should enable the export possibility of the particular IDE. In case of EmBlocks, it supports all the GCC_TOOLCHAIN projects.  But it appears that the toolchain variable isn't used by the front-end.

Is this a bug? if not what is the meaning of the toolchain variable in the exporter?

Thanks.

title: [EXPORT][Online Compiler] to gcc_arm, coide, emblocks
body:
I just tried the new available exporter in the online IDE. Just the blinky example with NUCLEO_F411 as the platform.

When I compare the results with the IAR exporter which was available before there is a lot of staff missing in the for the new available exporters.

All object files, libraries, linker script are missing. The Vision exporter creates a zip with these files. Coide, gcc_arm and emblocks exporter don't do that.

What did we wrong?

title: fix for the case where there are multiple tickers firing at nearly the s...
[DISCO_F429ZI] correction of RAM memory layout in linker script and stdio_uart config
body:
All test without any peripherals ("peripherals": []) are OK with these two corrections.
- RAM start address was wrong - overlaped with interrupt vector table
- wrong uart config (pins and uart number) for stdio uart

title: [FRDM-K64F] Fix FOPT EzPort bit documentation and set it to disable at s...
body:
...tart-up to

allow proper booting when powered from the K64F USB port. Refer to issue (#569).

title: Fixed the startup_LPC11xx.s files in ARM Micro and ARM STD - they had wr...
body:
...ong memory size;

Scatter files were adjusted to reserve the stack to prevent stack overwrite on the online compiler.

title: Host test refactoring - prepare to clean up host test implementation
body:
### Changes:

Just made initial changes in host test code as a starting point for more intrusive refactoring.
1. Removed magic values,
2. Host test refactoring: created separate enum like class for test result strings
3. Use special function (notify) to print and flush so data stdout data from host test in immediately transferred to test suite via queue.
- Please ignore tests NET_1 and NET_7 failing, they are failing because mbed.org address changed to developer.mbed.org. It was fixed and delivered as minor issue to master directly.
### Verification

To check if my implementation works I've ran all tests with modified host tests:

```

title: Added IAR support for LPC1347
body:
Just did one, want to know if there is anything i have missunderstood. 
Regards Gustav

title: HAL : [LPC824] Fix SPI1 SWM table
body:
- Fix SPI ch1 switch matrix table value - detected by SPI_MASTER test
  case
- Add LPC824 pinout for some test cases
- [LPC824] spi_api.c code refactoring

title: updating to v7.1.0 of the Nordic soft-device.
body: Please review the change to targets.py. thanks.

title: HAL: NRF51 - expand pinmap for two serial peripherals
body:
As a user stated in the following link
http://developer.mbed.org/questions/4917/Using-other-Pins-for-I2C-SPI

"The GPIOs used for each two-wire interface line can be chosen from any GPIO on the device and are independently configurable."
